TunableTuple.name: CONE_CONSTRAINT
TunableTuple.description: Cone constraint sim must satisfy before running greeting social. This is intersected with facing, line of sight and adjustment constraint which is also done through code.

Tunable.name: angular_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the angular cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: apply_offset_on_cost
Tunable.description: If checked, the offset defined above will affect how the constraint cost is calculated.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_angle
Tunable.description: The angular extents of an ideal region as a fraction of angle.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_max
Tunable.description: The radial upper bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_min
Tunable.description: The radial lower bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces. Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description: An offset (rotation) in degrees. By default the cone will face the forward vector of the object. Use an offset to rotate the cone to face a different direction.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid. NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

Tunable.name: GREETED_RELATIONSHIP_BIT
Tunable.description: The relationship bit between greeted Sims.

TunableList.name: GROUP_GREETINGS
TunableList.description: Group greetings play on the Sim relative to a target Sim. These greetings are only played on the actor. The PickedSim participant type will contain all Sims that should greet the actor in return, so you can make a reaction that greets the actor and push it from interactions in this list.

TunableTuple.description: Prioritized greetings. Place content that is pack specific at a higher priority.

Tunable.name: priority
Tunable.description: The relative priority of this affordance compared to other affordances in this list.

TunableList.name: TARGETED_GREETINGS
TunableList.description: Targeted greetings play between two Sims and are only available in the scenario that the actor wants to socialize with a target Sim that is not already socializing. These can be touching socials like hugging or hi fives.

TunableTuple.description: Prioritized greetings. Place content that is pack specific at a higher priority.

Tunable.name: priority
Tunable.description: The relative priority of this affordance compared to other affordances in this list.
